title: VAR-PZ: Constraining the Photometric Redshifts of Quasars using Variability
summary: This paper explores constraining photometric redshifts of quasars using variability data from the Vera C. Rubin Observatory LSST survey. The study leverages the survey's exceptional cadence and sensitivity for UV/optical/NIR monitoring of Active Galactic Nuclei (AGNs), addressing the challenge of spectroscopic follow-up for a large number of sources.
usefulness_reason: The paper discusses "survey's exceptional cadence and sensitivity" and "UV/optical/NIR monitoring of a significant fraction of these objects," which directly relates to "Survey data" and "Spatio Temporal" aspects (monitoring over time and space). While not explicitly a point process, the detection of AGNs can be seen as events in space and time.
